div.div: The locations for which COI Barcode Data were available from BOLD for Group I.
div.p: The black triangles indicate localities with GPS coordinates, the red circles indicate countries for which GPS data were not available, and the blue squares indicate the study site (Aras River Research Station). Red and blue shaded areas indicate the general distribution areas for clades. a) Coturnix coturnix b) Cuculus canorus c) Ficedula parva d) Oenanthe hispanica e) Emberiza citrinella f) Emberiza hortulana.
Click here for additional data file.

div.div: The locations for which COI Barcode Data were available from BOLD for Group II.
div.p: The black triangles indicate localities with GPS coordinates, the red circles indicate countries for which GPS data were not available, and the blue squares indicate the study site (Aras River Research Station) a) Lanius minor b) Acrocephalus palustris c) Saxicola rubetra d) Emberiza calandra.
Click here for additional data file.

Red, a) Alcedo atthis b) Coracias garrulus c) Oriolus oriolus d) Galerida cristata e) Remiz pendulinus f) Cettia cetti g) Phylloscopus trochilus h) Locustella luscinioides i) Sylvia nisoria j) Muscicapa striata k) Luscinia svecica l) Turdus merula m) Sylvia atricapilla n) Passer domesticus o) Passer montanus
